tool.name: FileMerger
tool.description: Merges several MS files into one file
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in_cond.in && #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else ln -s '$in_cond.in' 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' && #end if mkdir out && #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir rt_concat_trafo_out && mkdir ${' '.join(["'rt_concat_trafo_out/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${out_type}' #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -rt_concat:trafo_out ${' '.join(["'rt_concat_trafo_out/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext("trafoxml")) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') ${' '.join(["&& mv -n 'rt_concat_trafo_out/%(bn)s/%(id)s.%(gext)s' 'rt_concat_trafo_out/%(bn)s/%(id)s'"%{"bn": i, "id": re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), "gext": $gxy2omsext("trafoxml")} for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in_select
param.label: Run tool in batch mode for -in
param.option: Yes: process each dataset in an independent job

param.name: out_type
param.label: File type of output out (Output file)
Store the original filename in each feature using meta value "file_origin" (for featureXML and consensusXML only)
(ConsensusXML-only) Append quantitative information about features row-wise or column-wise
param.help: - 'append_rows' is usually used when the inputs come from the same MS run (e.g. caused by manual splitting or multiple algorithms on the same file). - 'append_cols' when you want to combine consensusXMLs from e.g. different fractions to be summarized in ProteinQuantifier or jointly exported with MzTabExporter

section.name: rt_concat
section.title: Options for concatenating files in the retention time (RT) dimension
section.help: The RT ranges of inputs are adjusted so they don't overlap in the merged file (traML input not supported)

param.name: gap
param.label: The amount of gap (in seconds) to insert between the RT ranges of different input files
param.help: RT concatenation is enabled if a value > 0 is set

section.name: raw
section.title: Options for raw data input/output (primarily for DTA files)

param.name: rt_auto
param.label: Assign retention times automatically (integers starting at 1)

param.name: rt_custom
param.label: List of custom retention times that are assigned to the files
param.help: The number of given retention times must be equal to the number of input files (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: rt_filename
param.label: Try to guess the retention time of a file based on the filename
param.help: This option is useful for merging DTA files, where filenames should contain the string 'rt' directly followed by a floating point number, e.g. 'my_spectrum_rt2795.15.dta'

param.name: ms_level
param.label: If 1 or higher, this number is assigned to spectra as the MS level
param.help: This option is useful for DTA files which do not contain MS level information

param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs
param.option: trafo_out (Output of retention time transformations that were applied to the input files to produce non-overlapping RT ranges)

collection.name: rt_concat_trafo_out
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: rt_concat:trafo_out
collection.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "trafo_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Merges several MS files into one file.
For more information, visit https://openms.de/doxygen/release/3.1.0/html/TOPP_FileMerger.html
